alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 8:29AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Floyd and southern Pike Counties through 900 AM EST... At 829 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Beaver, or 8 miles southwest of Pikeville, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Shelbiana, Garden Village, Rockhouse, Chloe and Lookout around 835 AM EST. Elkhorn City, Marrowbone, Fishtrap Lake, Belcher and Cedarville around 840 AM EST. Mouthcard, Biggs and Phyllis around 845 AM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Toonerville, Fedscreek, Coleman, Paw Paw and Argo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
